[Matthew] Previously on Love Island...

[Tre]
The girl I want to couple up with is...
Justine.
[Matthew] The islanders said goodbye.

-I will miss her a lot.
-Love you.

-And then...
-Bring on the boys!

-You're beautiful.
-Oh my God, you got me a little hot.
It's our first night as a couple.
You have to keep your options open.

-I'm not happy.
-You are so cute.
Lay it on me.

-How would you feel if she entertained it?
-It would be a slap in the face.

-Would you look at her different?
-Yeah, 100 percent.

From day one, I have poured
everything I got into her,

and she's gonna throw all that out
over some dude for a day?
[Matthew] Tonight!
[Tre] Oh my gosh.
She gonna walk straight to the...
[Matthew] The pressure...
Are you into any of them?
Am I gonna compete with this dude?
[Matthew] ...is starting to show.
Just stay cool.
Chill out, you said?

-What's your problem?
-Listen to him.
What is she doing?
You guys want drama? I'll show you drama.
[groaning]
[theme music plays]
[Matthew] Welcome to Love Island!

p.span: tonight's episode is a sizzling skillet

div.p:
-of steaming islander fajitas.
-[phone chimes]

-I got a text!
-Rachel was invited on a date...
[reading text]

-[all scream]
-That was so disrespectful!

-And Carrington...
-I got a text!

p.span: who was going on her second date
of the night with new boy Calvin.

div.p: Oh, my God! "No need to wait up."

Dude, she's going to be
sleeping in my bed tonight,
so have fun taking her on a date.

Have fun wasting your time 'cause
she's coming back home with me.
At this point, bring it on.
He just declared war.

-Oh my gosh.
-All right.
I promise I won't come back holding hands.

-I hope not.
-No, I won't do that to you.

-No.
-[man] Caleb sounds...

-[woman] Good luck, babe!
-Watch yourself.

She has every right to get to know him.
We ain't girlfriend and boyfriend,

you know what I am saying, so...
we taking it slow.

And we at a good pace and I feel
like she feel the same way.

So we just gonna see how it go
when she come back.

All I'm saying, bro,
is y'all shouldn't worry, bro.
[laughing]

p.span: Kierstan was invited on a date with new
islander and slice of mancake, Calvin.

div.p:
-Come on in. Of course.
-Thank you.

-Ooh. So what's your name?
-Calvin.

-I'm Kierstan, nice to meet you.
-Great to meet you.

-Uh, Austin? Austin, Texas?
-Oh yeah,

I keep forgetting that you already
know things about me.

-I'm, like, how...
-I'm from Houston.
[exclaims] Another Texas person!
I have been waiting, I've been hoping.
Hey, here's...

-To...
-Texans.

-Here's to Texans.
-That's it.

-Hello.
-Yo, I'm Caleb.
Nice to meet you, I'm Rachel.

-Just wanna give you a hug...
-Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah.

-How are you?
-I'm doing well, how are you?
Good, yeah, I'm good.
I'm super excited.
Oh good, yeah, me too.

-Are you?
-I'm getting there.

-I want to get to know you a little bit.
-Alright. Yeah.

-Are you having fun here?
-Yeah, so far.

It's been... been a busy night.
Recoupling for the first time.

Yeah, I can tell you're
for real right now.

Yeah. I want to get to know you, honestly.
I want to give you a fair shot.

-Cool.
-And I want to be transparent with you.

Like it has been really good
with Jeremiah. So it is...

It is gonna take a lot to, like,
to kind of like turn my head...

-I ain't even worried about all that.
-Alright.

-I'm not trying to be rude, cut you off...
-Oh, yeah!

I just wanna get a feeling for you,
you know what I am saying?

I see you've been able to connect with
this guy for a couple of days, and like...

-I'm not trying to be disrespectful...
-Yeah, I will say: respect, honesty,

-trust... Okay, that.
-I'm a super up-front person.

Like, you're gonna know
exactly where I stand.
Okay, keep talking.

I'm going in a little blind,
so in terms of where you're at

-in the villa, relationships, couples...
-So, yeah...

I get it, you know, you're coupled up
and stuff like that.

In terms of... which doesn't really
worry me at all... But moving forward,

are you... would you say
kind of like... wouldn't be open to...

-you know, chatting...
-When I'm tanning, come pull me,

-of course.
-Sure.

-Of course. So...
-Yeah. Let's go swim together.

Oh yeah, splish splash,
we'll get it going.
Stop it! [laughs]

[Matthew] While Calvin and Kierstan
keep wining and dining,

-You alright?
-No, I'm good.

-I'm not stressed...
-Bro, you good, I'm telling you.
I know, I'm not stressed, I'm not worried.

He took my special night away
from me, so I'm kind of pissed.

The only person that could ruin
all this is you.

-Yep. I agree.
-That's it.

It is okay to be mad. Like, she got picked
by two guys. She's hot, that's good.

-It is.
-You the last dude

-that she gets to see tonight.
-Yeah.

You get to kiss on her.
You get to do all that.

-They don't get to do any of that.
-Yeah.
It'll be good.

[Matthew] New date, same savaganan blanc--
white wine!
You the type to take the lead?

-A little bit.
-A little bit or a lot a bit?

Probably a lot a bit. I like
to call the shots, not gonna lie.

-I like that. That's very attractive.
-Okay.
I'm a yes man.
Oh, alright! So you're cool with, like--

Okay, yeah. Okay, well, if anyone
takes the lead, okay, got you.
Let's cheers to a good first date.

I'm looking forward to getting
to know you more.
Yeah.
And... We'll see where this goes.
All right, cheers.

Obviously I chose you
'cause you're beautiful...

-Was gonna ask, "Why did you pick me?"
-You're...

You're spunky, you're sassy,
you got a little bit of that fire that...

-Kinda say whatever I'm feeling.
-Absolutely.
Then I'm kinda like, "Ahh..."
It's okay, own it. You gotta own that.

-I do own it.
-And that's why I chose you.
What's your type?

Um... For me, it needs to obviously...
There needs to be a physical attraction...

-Of course.
...but that personality, you know.

And someone that can be a friend,
you know, long-term.

I feel like everyone in the villa's
gonna love you.

We'll see if they can handle
two sassy Texans in there.

Oh my God, I was just thinking
about that. Cheers again.

Honestly, cheers to that.
Cheers to the sass.

[Matthew] After getting lost
on the casino floor for nine hours,

p.span: to a gossip of nervous hunks.

div.p:
Should I be upset if she goes
straight to the girls or something.

Yes. If she doesn't come over
and talk to you...

-That's...
-And don't say nothing, bro.

Wait, let's go get her,
let's go get her...

-Hi!
-Tell us about it.
Wait, we should all come together.
What did he look like?

-Who?
-Your date.

-Hold on, guys!
-We want to know.
We've been sitting here waiting.

-Suspense was building... Okay.
-All right, let's take a seat.

I don't know, I feel like you guys
will have a lot of questions.

-Hell yeah.
-So, uh... first things first.
Come, come. Come on.

Is the man handsome? Because
my girl's on a date with both of them.
I know. How did you know that?
Because the dude said, "Hey, dude."

-"Taking her out. She won't be back."
-Took you long enough.
Talk to us, tell us.

Okay, so there's two guys
and we went on a date with them.

-Like, double?
-No, like, single date...

-Just one-on-one?
-Just let her talk.

-But...
-Let her get it out.
So I went on a date with Calvin.
How did they look?
They're good-looking.

-Like, was he big, tall?
-You gotta explain it a little more.

Calvin was in fitness,
I think, which is ironic.

-So, is he jacked or what?
-Does he look like me?
No, no, no, no. He's, like, in good shape.

He said he picked me 'cause
he thought I was just, like, chill.

-And he was nervous--
-Did he say anything about me?

-Yeah, he mentioned you.
-What did he say?
That, like, we made out a lot on TV.

-That is really funny.
-How does that make you feel?

-Can I pull you aside and...
-Yeah. Let's...
Alright, let's do that.
Wait, but one second, one second.
I'll be right back.

-Okay, gonna go to the bathroom?
-Yeah, yeah.

-He good, bro.
-It'll be all right.

[James] I'm pretty outgoing, pretty funny,
pretty positive,

and me and Moira
do have something special. So...
He has to be ten times better than me.
And I don't see that happening.
[Matthew] Or just marginally times better.
Can I talk to you for a second?
Yeah, yeah, come on up.
Okay.
Sorry, I was about to come find you.
I can't hide my smile.
Oh no.

-Where's Mackenzie?
-She's talking with Moira.

-Oh.
-Just up top.
I feel way better now.

-Spill the tea, sis.
-Okay.

Calvin, 5'11", freckles, like,
the greatest smile ever, 25 years old.

And he was just, like, so, like...
so sassy, so flirty, so everything

that, like... honestly, like James
when I first meet him.

But I always am trying to look
to get to know

the James that is, like,
calm and chill. So I go to Calvin,

I was like, "Honestly,
my head isn't turning."
"I'm in a relationship with James."

But I did... by the end
of the conversation, I was like,

so smitten, and I was like,
"I would be very interested

in getting to know you if you pulled me
aside in more talks or whatever."

I'm gonna be, like,
real with you. Keep it 100.
As much as I love James and I love you,
it's not perfect in every way.

-Yeah.
-And who knows?

Maybe we'll get to know this guy
and maybe it...

-Maybe it'll be different.
-I'm so friggin' bad.

No! It's not like you guys
are boyfriend and girlfriend.
Yeah.

-You know?
-This other guy is, like, giving me that

kind of attention that's a little bit
more like... like, chill,
which is who I am.

I think you are a girl who's
very in touch with her feelings,

and you know who you are
and you understand that.

Versus, he is more the type that...
he might see them,

but he really just wants to almost pretend
like they're not there and move forward.

Well, what should I-- Should I say
anything more to James? Like I...

Um... It's up to you.
I mean, I think that's good.

'Cause wouldn't you want to know
if James' type walked in?

Yeah. I would. You're right,
and that's what I want to say.
I still want to have a talk with James.

And, I mean, I couldn't even
imagine being in his position right now,

being in his shoes.
I do want to tell him the truth.
I want to tell him that Calvin is my type.

That being said, you know,
I have to continue to follow my heart

and... I don't know where
that's going to take me.

I don't even know how, like,
he could have liked me. That, I just--
Are you kidding me?

Like, out of everything he's seen.
Whatever.

Moira, you are gorgeous,
you are kind, you are funny.
I don't even know what to do.
I think that you guys can chat.

-Do you want to go for a chat?
-I do.

-You wanna go over here?
-Yeah.
Come over here.

I feel for him
'cause that could be us next.

-It could be.
-Yeah.

Because he was sure as hell that...
He was like, "I'm not worried at all."
And now look. You know?
So, good news?
Bad news? Fun news?
What's that smirk about? It's new.
It's a new smile you have on you.
Is it new?
Yeah.

-How's it going?
-Good.
How was your time?
It was good.

I mean, we didn't have too much time
to, like, get to know each other, but...
Yeah. Did you feel anything?

I mean, yeah, I gotta be real with you.
That's why I wanted to have a chat.

It's like, he was my type.
You know, I told him everything.

-I am in here with you, for you.
-Mm-hmm.

I was up front and honest about that,
but that being said, like...

you know, I didn't want to, like,
blindside you when he comes in.
And, like, he is my type.
Gonna try to get to know him more?

I mean, he is in here
to get to know everybody.
That's what I am saying, but you know...

Like if he pulls me aside for a chat,
like, I won't say no to that.

Are you gonna stop being lovey-dovey
around me because he's here?

Would you not make-- Are you
going to go slower with me
because he's next to you?

Honestly, he's like here for like--
He hasn't even come in yet, right?

I can tell in your face
you're feeling him a little bit.
No, I know.

I still haven't decided, you know,
how I feel about James and I.

But he's not helping his case
by coming on too strong.

I keep telling him I need my space,
but the message just does not get through.

-Like, I just don't understand.
-I don't even know him.

So why are you saying you were
nervous and, "Oh, he's my type"?

-That's cool.
-What do you mean,
why am I saying that?
I'm just trying to be open and honest.

That is good.
Our communication is perfect.

I'm glad you came up to me, and you
had a good time. Right? And...

Before the date, you know, you kissed me
good-bye, "I don't even want to go."

"I'll tell him we're gonna be friends."
Is that what you want with him?

You were, "Hey, he's gonna
be my new friend."

You know what I am saying?
Is this gonna be your new friend

or are you gonna really try
to get to know him

with a whole, like,
relationship thing, with...
Including, you know, who I am,

and how I am towards you
and how I feel for you.

And now, gonna be talking
to this dude, trying to win you over?
Is that what you're saying?

-Are you warning me?
-I don't know what I'm say--

Honestly, I don't really like
your attitude right now.

What are you talking about?
It's nerve-racking.

But why are you putting
all this pressure on me?
I'm not putting any pressure on you.
You kind of are.

-How? For what?
-You're stressing me out.

Because I'm trying to be open
and honest with you about everything,

-and yet you're coming at me.
-I'm not coming at you at all.

-Yes, you are.
-How?

This is nerve-racking. The whole night
I've been waiting on you...

-I know, and I feel bad about that.
-If the roles were reversed,

-you would be the same thing.
-I don't think I would have. Like...

But in this moment, when I've just
had something really dramatic,

such as my best friend leaving,
a date like this, where I tell you

he's my type, all this information,
like I personally don't don't think

you should be coming at me
telling me that I have to, like, stop.
I think you should just be supportive.

[Matthew] Kierstan and Rachel
are still on their dates with new boys

p.span: even setting foot in the villa,
the fragile James and Moira partnership.

div.p:
Hey, Mackenzie, I just talked to Moira
and she started off kind of terrible

because she was like,
"Oh yeah, he's my type."

-I told her to be honest about that.
-Yeah, which is cool, and she did.

My conclusion when she
told me that was, "Okay."
"Am I gonna compete with this dude?"

"Are you going to like stop progressing
the relationship that we're having?"

No, but she was honest about the fact
and honest with you, like...

-The date was fun.
-Yeah.
And he is her typical type.
What's her type? What's the guy look like?

Uh, 5'11", like, freckles,
like, really buff.
Freckles.

From my perspective, in these situations,
the biggest mistake you can make

is changing your behavior
because you're concerned
about what's going to happen.
Because that will push her away.

I think that you've gotta show
you're not the type of guy

who is going to be intimidated
by every guy that walks in here.

It could be frickin' Brad Pitt
and you would not be phased.

-Do you feel better about it?
-Yeah.

-Do you know what I'm saying?
-Hundred percent.

-Okay, cool.
-Good to go.
Calvin and I literally hit it off so well.

We met each other for 20 seconds,
I'm literally, like, ear to ear,
like, so cute, so I'm...
trying to keep it together, but anyway...

I just feel like I know it's a very, very
tough position to be in.

But at the end of the day, if a 20-second
conversation has you smitten

after spending days with James,
like, that is saying something.

-Yeah.
-And if you tell yourself,

"I owe it to James to only, you know,
focus on him,"
like, if I would have done that with Tre,

I wouldn't be where I'm at
with Johnny right now.

Things are gonna work themselves out,
but you have to put yourself first.
And who cares what anyone else thinks?

-You know what I mean?
-Yeah.

I promise they're all nice,
they're all nice.

-Hi.
-Yo.

-What up?
-Yo.
Oh.
What's up, what's up?

-What's up, man? I'm Caleb.
-I'm James, man.

-Nice to meet you.
-You too.

-How's it going, man?
-I'm Calvin.
I like that shirt, bro.
Might have to rock it.

-Hey, good to see you, man.
-[Calvin] I made it, I'm here.

It's a lot to take in, but everyone seems
super chill for the most part, right?
And super genuine.

-Good to see you, man. Where you from?
-Uh, Texas.
Texas, nice. That's what's up.
But we'll see.

We'll see what see what toes
get stepped on.

-How were the dates?
-It was cool.

Yeah, they're both beautiful, solid
chicks. I really enjoyed myself. Cool.

-I had fun.
-Your turn!

Yeah! I mean, same thing. Both girls,
Moira and Kierstan, great girls,

and looking forward to getting
to know everyone, you know,

-be open and honest with everyone.
-Like I said, It's gonna be fun, man.

-They're all fun. They're very sweet.
-Yeah.
Are you guys tired?

I mean, I know we're kind of exhausted,
but we can stay up and chat if you want.
I'm down to kick it.

I can show you around. I don't
know if you want to stay here.

Is there like, bedtimes here?
What's going on?
Two good people. They seem-- Right?

-Hey.
-What?
They seem pretty cool.
Yeah, they're nice.

Why are you...? I'm just trying to talk
to you for a second. They're cool, right?

-I already said that before.
-What?
Why are you shaking... Are you okay?
I'm just... I'm having fun.

-Yeah.
-Hope you're doing okay.

-You okay?
-Yeah.

-How are you doing...?
-Yeah. Chill.

-"Chill the **** out," she said.
-[all chattering]
That what you said?
I literally can't right now.

-I, like, actually...
-What's her problem? What's your problem?

-Like, listen to him.
-What is she doing?
Come on, James.

-I might actually wanna go.
-Girl talk, without James.

-Just kidding. I love your girl talk.
-Makes no sense.
Makes no sense. So confusing.

-I'm gonna stay here.
-Let's hear from everyone.

-Tell us everything.
-Okay, so...
You guys want drama, I'll show you drama.

Yo, bro, there's something wrong
with the girl you chose, bro.
There's something wrong with her.

-Oh yeah?
-Yeah.
This is ridiculous.
Makes no sense.
[all chattering]
I'm not about this, man.

Nah, man, I was just trying to hang out...
[continues, indistinct]

No, she's being-- I'm not even
doing anything.

She was saying chill the **** out
when I was chill.

If you could write a book
on what not to do, James did that.

If I was James, I would feel
a bit concerned right now.
That's hard, man.

[Matthew] So James is all "How to Lose
a Girl in Ten Sentences",
he's more Silence of the Lambs .

-How are you feeling?
-I feel good.

Um... You know, I feel like we talked
about this before.

We were just, like, honesty,
transparency, so important to both of us.

Um, so that being said,
the date did go really well.

And it's one of those things
where I did tell him, like,
I'd be open to having more conversations.

Oh, yeah, as you should. As long as you
communicating, we straight, we good.

Obviously, like, I care so much
about Jeremiah

and I'm so excited
about how things are going.

But, you realize like, "Oh yeah,
I am here to date around."
And it's okay.
Yeah.

[Jeremiah]
She a good girl. We taking it slow,

but I'm pretty confident
in where I stand right now,
you know what I'm saying? So...

I ain't too much worried
about it right now.

-All right? I'm gonna go take a shower.
-Yeah.
All right, see you in bed.

-All right. You in.
-[laughs]

So, what's the tea? Are you
feeling Calvin or Caleb?

I mean, feeling them as in, like, to where
my head would be turned or like,
down to talk to them?

Are you feeling them in like
a dating aspect?

I mean, like, if they do pull me
I'm gonna talk to them.

But, like, I'd still be
thinking about you.

Caleb is everything I'm looking for
because he is driven.

You know, smart, successful, sexy,
but so is Carrington.

Like, I can't get Carrington
out of my mind.

-Guess where you get to sleep?
-I know.

-In my bed.
-Oh, you mean our bed?

-Oh yeah, in our bed.
-In our bed.
I missed you so much.
[melancholy pop music]
Whoo! I am feeling some sort of way.

James has showed his true colors to me
and that's a him problem.
I don't know.
[Matthew] Good morning, Vegas!

p.span: and hopefully that will wash away the
bitter aftertaste of last night's drama.
Our couples are Cely and Johnny,
Mackenzie and Connor, Tre and Justine,
Kierstan and Carrington, Moira and James,
But also in the villa are
the new single guys Calvin and Caleb.

div.p: [pop music continues]

-Morning!
-Morning.
Oh my God, I have to pee so bad.

-What up?
-What's up, man?

Last night was kind of nerve-racking
and a lot of emotion.

I know I'm high energy and I'm all about
her, but I need to take a step back.

New boys in the villa.
I'm gonna dress cute.
I love it.
"Good morning!" Like, who does that?

We were all kind of like,
"What's going on?"
So how you feeling? What's up?

-What's up?
-Just chillin'.

I just want to know
how you thought last night went.
I thought last night went very well.

Like our conversation flowed easily.
You definitely made him squirm.

Everyone did. He's like, "'Course you went
on two dates. I'm not even surprised."
I'm like, "Yes."
No, I am still very much Carrington.

Okay. Obviously I'm not trying to tell you
what to do or how to handle anything.

You and him have some type
of chemistry, right?

-For sure.
-Have to see where that goes.

But I feel like you might be selling
yourself short if you didn't at least

-kinda keep yourself open-minded to me...
-Good to know. Yeah.
...or whoever else comes in here.
[Caleb] I can tell Kierstan is interested.

There is some type of attraction
that I can feel in the air
when we're talking to each other.

But at the same time, she feels
this loyalty towards Carrington.

I'm not the type to just chase
and chase and chase

because when you chase something,
it's gonna run.

Right now I am all in on him,
but that doesn't mean that talks
couldn't potentially change that.

Even if you just want to have the most
casual chat, I'm always open.

We don't always have to sit here
and be like,

"What is your deepest darkest fear?
What are you looking for?"

-The ocean.
-Yo.
How are the chats going?

-Just one so far?
-Yeah.

-Just pulled Kierstan for a little chat.
-Yeah.

Have you been able to talk
to anybody outside the dates?

No, I was actually-- You know, Moira,
I'll pull her.

I just kind of want to know
what's going on. Like,

you know, I don't know if you felt it but
I feel like there's a little bit of, like,

-people like... giving each other looks.
-They-- Yeah.

That coupling looks like they
had a rough day yesterday.

-Yeah.
-It's crazy, man.

And so that is why I want
to chat with her, be like, "Hey, look."

You know, "How did things go?
How'd he take it?" You know.

"Where are you at?" Because coming
in, it's such a tight-knit, like...
I know, bro, that's the thing, is...

We're here to
just pull it open a little bit.

-We're here for something.
-Yeah.

-What up?
-Nothing.

-How you doing?
-Good.

-Chillin? Yeah?
-Yeah.

-Do you want to talk?
-Where do you want to talk?

I don't know, I just wanna...
talk, hang out.
You wanna talk to me? About life?
Um, I'm working through some things.
Last night was just a lot.

And I can't just forget things happened
and forget the way I feel.

But nothing happened.
I didn't do anything, like, wrong.
We both handled it in a different way.

I don't know why it's all on me,
you're saying, and then you don't wanna...

Just like, forgiving. There's nothing
to forgive. Nothing happened.
I don't know what you're thinking.
You make me so confused sometimes.

-I don't know...
-You're getting, like, defensive.
I'm always... You said that last night.

I was asking how your date was
and you were like, "Calm down."
I'm not doing anything wrong.

I'm just hanging out,
trying to talk to you.

I feel like you didn't give me a chance
to, like, have my feelings.

You were kind of like expecting me
to comfort you
and tell you everything that had happened.
And I just wasn't in a good place.

I was in the same place as
Carrington and Kierstan,
and he did the same thing.

I didn't want to bombard...
"How was your night? Okay, cool."

"Is it gonna be different between us?"
And obviously it is.

Well, I've already told you that I'm
still a little bit upset about last night

and I'm trying to get over it,
but I just need a little bit more time.

-Yeah.
-Please don't laugh in my face

when I'm trying to tell you
how I'm really feeling.
You're not even looking at me.
You're funny. You're something else.

-I mean, I don't even know anymore.
-Okay.
If that's how you feel.
You're the one that's giving me the shade.
I'm not doing anything wrong.

I felt like you were pretty defensive.
Like, I honestly needed space.
And I should've told you that.

If you did respect me and really
like me, you would say okay,

-and give it to me.
-I have been.
I mean, well, you want to ignore me? Cool.

You want to just walk around and not talk
to me? I was trying to have a conversa--

You don't like, initiate any
conversation. You can't even look at me.

-I'm just-- I'm trying...
-No, seriously.

I really can't talk to you right now,
I'm sorry.
I'm gonna go fill up my water bottle.
I told you I just want a little space.
Sheesh!

I don't like the way he reacted
last night.
I was really turned off by it.

And I think his emotions
are getting the best of him.

Honestly, it's not attractive and it is
not making me want to be with him.
I can't.
All right, perfect.
I honestly can't take this.
This is so funny.
I just want to go home.

[Matthew] Tonight's show
is a literal nail-biter.

p.span: He just needs to do it with Moira.

div.p:
I'm freaking over today.
I just want to go home.
I know.

[James] She's so condescending.
There is something wrong with her.

[Mackenzie] I think she might just need
a moment. It's hard to say.
[James] I'm done with her.

[Mackenzie] No, James, don't say
that stuff, that's not nice.

[James] She can't talk to me like that.
She thinks I'm some peasant,
can't even talk to me.
So, she can couple up with that dude.

[Mackenzie] I don't think that like...
calling names and saying...

and like, these outbursts, I just don't
think that's the way to handle it.

I don't know why guys think it's
acceptable to say, "He can have her."

She can do whatever she wants.
That's not your decision.

Just let her go for, like, an hour
or something, okay?
I think you gotta be respectful.
Why am I the bad guy here?

If she wants to move on,
I can guarantee you
it's not because he took her.
It's because she left.

I genuinely believe you should give it
space. You need to give each other space.

I tried. She can't even look at me.
She can't even--

Shop shifting it onto her. This is about
your actions and what are you doing.

Accept accountability for how you
are acting. That is unacceptable.

Do not talk to a woman like that, that's
all I've gotta say. Give her her space.

-I didn't even say anything...
-Stop-- You're not saying anything?

You're coming around ranting
about it to everybody.
I cannot.

[Matthew] Little tricky to make
a lighthearted comment to take us

p.span: into the next scene but I guess
I can give it a Tre.

div.p: [exclaims] Hey, I did it.
[Justine] How's your morning?

-Great. Started off good.
-Yeah?

I, like, lost sleep over this last night,
because I like, I stress very easily.

-What happened?
-So I just like...

I'm like a very
take-it-slow kind of person.

And I think you know that from, you know,
the kissing conversation.

The way I see it,
everybody moves at different paces.

So like, I'm cool with going at your
pace, you don't have to worry about that.

I appreciate that. And like, see,
that makes me feel better because...

I was expecting you to say something
waaaay worse.

-Like what?
-I don't know.

[Tre] I've been single for a long time
and had my wild phase in college, so...

Now that Justine are together, we get an
opportunity to get closer to each other,
get to know each other.
I'm excited to see where things go and...
I'm just happy to be coupled up with her.
It feels good not to be single anymore.

At the end of the day, I want you to
realize I picked you for a reason,

And I want to continue to get to know you
because I feel like

-we could have something special.
-Yeah.

[Matthew]
Moira's enthusiasm for James seems brief.

p.span: Let's see if she is feeling

div.p:
You want to chat about it, if you don't,
like... It's whatever.
It's really up to you, 'cause...

I mean, it's kind of y'all's deal,
you know.

I appreciate you.
He's just reacting like a little child.

Yeah. People show colors, whether
it's true or false, whatever, like...

-based on situations.
-I'm getting colors. I'm getting...
Wrong colors? Red colors?

I'm seeing some flags
and they're not white.

-They're red flags.
-Yeah.
Yeah, I am smitten with Calvin, for sure.
He's like such a sweetheart.

I honestly... And he's a breath of fresh
air. It's so easy to talk to him.

I wouldn't overthink things, honestly.
Like...

Don't let it affect the rest of the day,
don't let it affect the rest of the night.

-Like...
-You don't think so? Yeah.

-Just get back on the horse, right?
-Yeah.

Don't let it affect me. Just be like--
Just forget about it.

-Forget about it... I mean...
-Okay.

-Don't forget, but you know.
-Yeah.
He's so down to earth.
He's so chill.

You're not competing on
who's gonna say what next.

You just wanna, like, continue
the conversation like a moving river.
Like, it's so easy.
Thank you so much.
It does feel really good to talk to you.

-Of course.
-You seem really cool.
Today has been on the top of my mind,

and there's no part of me that's ready
to open up to James at this point.
Obviously, it's like weird, so like...

And that's like, I'll come out
and I'll say like, "Hey, are you good?"

-"Are you okay?"
-Yeah.

And if you're like, "Hey, I'm fine,"
I'll walk away, whatever.

-You know, I get that...
-Thank you so much.
...you're kind of like, figuring it out.
[melancholy pop song playing]

-Oooh!
-Oh my gosh, I want a yellow bed.
What?
You good? What you got on your mind?

No, I'm just... I'm just enjoying
this moment. Just taking it all in.

-Okay.
-Yeah. Yeah.

-You can come over here.
-[indistinct murmuring]
[slow pop song plays]

[Matthew] It's morning!
Or, as they call it in Vegas, bedtime.

p.span: Whew! It was an awkward night
who, much like my parents throughout

div.p: [slow pop music continues]

-Morning.
-Good morning.

Hope we can still be friends
after all this.
I don't want it to be weird or anything.
Sorry everything happened.
I know our spark was fun at first and...
things happened and I overreacted, but...

You're a cool person
and after all this, um,

it would be nice to still be friends
and talk and...
I hope for the best.
I care for you.
In the kitchen this morning,

James was not picking up on my mood
or the lack of conversation I was giving.
He wasn't asking me if I was okay.
I am not believing his apology.

There is no part of me that's ready
to open up to James at this point.
So it's really annoying.

I just didn't want it be to weird
when you walk by me or anything.
You know?
Yeah, no, I know.

[Matthew] Like a tattooed, shirtless,
door-to-door salesman,

p.span: Caleb is chatting up every girl
And I suspect Tres partner Justine

div.p:
Do you feel like you're
warming up to everybody?

It's crazy. I'm starting to see just how
quick everything moves in here.

-Mm-hmm.
-You know?
I 100% am open-minded.
And I'm gonna be like a book out here.

I'm going to talk to anybody who
wants to talk.

I want to find somebody that can
understand that this takes time.
It does take time.

And it's really challenging for people,
like... Some people can say,

-"Yeah, I don't care, talk to whoever,"
and like...

But now I do feel like I'm kind of at
a place where like... I've narrowed down

-my options, you know?
-Yeah.

And I'm really like...
You're one of the people I really
need to give myself a chance with.

-Yeah?
-I guess I'm putting that out there now.
Aw. I'm so flattered, thank you so much.

I love it. I usually try to play, like,
"I don't know, man."
Play it cool. Cards close to your chest.

No, I mean, that's definitely
nice to hear because like,

there was definitely an initial
attraction when I saw you, obviously.

And having conversations with you
is super easy.

-I feel the same way.
-Yeah.

[Justine] I'm definitely open to getting
to know Caleb because I mean, look at him.
Like... No, he's definitely a charmer

and he just carries himself
really well. So, yeah.

[Matthew] Well, this day has been
more draining than shutting down

p.span: a water park, so I think the islanders
deserve to go out for the night,

div.p:
I feel like it's like a metaphor
for our relationship.

-[phone dings]
-I got a text!

-[squeals]
-Moira got a text!

-[all cheering]
-What does it say?
I got a text!
[reading text]

-[all cheering]
-"Dress to impress." "Vegas behavior."

-[all cheering]
-Oh my God.
Oh, I just hurt my knee so bad.
[pop music playing]
"Yeah baby, it's Vegas night."
I'm freaking out.
Why are you freaking out?
"Roll the dice"?

-Take a chance... on love!
-Take a chance!

On someone who is not us.
All right, ladies...

My boobies are gonna be out,
my back's going to be out,

my legs are gonna be out.
It's all gonna be out.

If there's anyone that's gonna be really,
like, booed up, it's just gonna be like...

-You know what I'm saying?
-I don't think I can kiss Moira, though.
I look like a Spice Girl.
A Vegas Spice Girl.

-[all cheering]
-Vegas party, baby! Let's go!
I'm ready.
Release us!
Vegas night, baby. Let's go.

-Are you excited? You look good.
-Vegas!

[Matthew] Like a gymnast who practices
in an olive oil factory,

back up the island atop the Cromwell.

We may gamble in Vegas,
but we are not gambling for love.
[laughter, chattering]

Hey, it's about to get

[all cheering]

[Matthew] Fun party! Wait, I have
a producer in my ear telling me...

I bet they're about to go into
starting with me saying something like,
Next time: there's trouble in paradise.

"Connor, have a triple kiss

-[taunting tone] Mackenzie...
-Mm-mmm.
